claim: In Santa Clara County, the ratio (in percentage) of locally funded charter schools compared to all other funding types is about 66.7%.
extra_info: Ratio in percentage = (count(locally funded schools in Santa Clara) / count(all funding type schools in Santa Clara) * 100%
reasoning: The claim states the ratio of locally funded charter schools to all funding type schools in Santa Clara County is about 66.7%. Using the schools table, there are 20 locally funded charter schools out of 80 charter schools with a funding type, giving a ratio of 25.0%. Using the frpm table, 18 out of 60 gives 30.0%. Neither matches 66.7%. The claim is contradicted by the data.

content.text: I'll verify this claim step by step. Let me first explore the database schema to understand what data is available.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE frpm
(
    CDSCode                                       TEXT not null
        primary key,
    `Academic Year`                               TEXT  null,
    `County Code`                                 TEXT  null,
    `District Code`                               INTEGER         null,
    `School Code`                                 TEXT  null,
    `County Name`                                 TEXT null,
    `District Name`                               TEXT null,
    `School Name`                                 TEXT null,
    `District Type`                               TEXT null,
    `School Type`                                 TEXT null,
    `Educational Option Type`                     TEXT null,
    `NSLP Provision Status`                       TEXT null,
    `Charter School (Y/N)`                        INTEGER    null,
    `Charter School Number`                       TEXT  null,
    `Charter Funding Type`                        TEXT null,
    IRC                                           INTEGER    null,
    `Low Grade`                                   TEXT  null,
    `High Grade`                                  TEXT null,
    `Enrollment (K-12)`                           REAL      null,
    `Free Meal Count (K-12)`                      REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible Free (K-12)`            REAL       null,
    `FRPM Count (K-12)`                           REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (K-12)`            REAL       null,
    `Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`                      REAL       null,
    `Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)`                 REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17)`       REAL       null,
    `FRPM Count (Ages 5-17)`                      REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (Ages 5-17)`       REAL       null,
    `2013-14 CALPADS Fall 1 Certification Status` INTEGER    null,
    foreign key (CDSCode) references schools (CDSCode)
);
CREATE TABLE satscores
(
    cds         TEXT not null
        primary key,
    rtype       TEXT  not null,
    sname       TEXT null,
    dname       TEXT null,
    cname       TEXT null,
    enroll12    INTEGER         not null,
    NumTstTakr  INTEGER          not null,

    AvgScrWrite INTEGER          null,
    NumGE1500   INTEGER          null,
--     PctGE1500   double      null,
        foreign key (cds) references schools (CDSCode)
);
CREATE TABLE schools
(

content.text: I can see the `schools` table has `County`, `FundingType`, and `Charter` columns. Let me now query the data to verify the claim.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "SELECT FundingType, COUNT(*) FROM schools WHERE County = 'Santa Clara' AND Charter = 1 GROUP BY FundingType;"
input.description: Count charter schools by funding type in Santa Clara County

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM schools WHERE County = 'Santa Clara' AND Charter = 1 AND FundingType = 'Locally funded';"
input.description: Count locally funded charter schools in Santa Clara

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM schools WHERE County = 'Santa Clara' AND Charter = 1;"
input.description: Count all charter schools in Santa Clara

content.text: Now let me re-read the claim carefully. The hint says: "Ratio in percentage = (count(locally funded schools in Santa Clara) / count(all funding type schools in Santa Clara) * 100%)". This seems to be comparing locally funded charter schools to ALL charter schools with a funding type (not just "other" types). Let me compute:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "SELECT CAST(COUNT(CASE WHEN FundingType = 'Locally funded' THEN 1 END) AS REAL) / COUNT(CASE WHEN FundingType IS NOT NULL AND FundingType != '' THEN 1 END) * 100 FROM schools WHERE County = 'Santa Clara' AND Charter = 1;"
input.description: Compute ratio of locally funded to all funding type schools

content.text: So there are 80 charter schools with a non-empty funding type, and 2 with NULL/empty. Let me now compute the ratio using the hint's interpretation:

Neither gives 66.7%. Let me re-read the claim: "the ratio of locally funded charter schools **compared to all other funding types**". This could mean locally funded vs non-locally funded (i.e., 20 / (82 - 20) or 20/60). Let me check:

That's 33.3%, not 66.7%. But wait - maybe the claim is flipped. Let me check: 60/20 = 300%, not 66.7%. Or maybe the hint clarifies: "count(locally funded schools) / count(all funding type schools) * 100%". Let me re-read the hint more carefully.

The hint says the ratio = count(locally funded) / count(all funding type schools) * 100%. That gives 20/80 = 25% or 20/82 = 24.4%. Neither is 66.7%.

Let me also check if this could involve the `frpm` table instead:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/california_schools.sqlite" "SELECT \"Charter Funding Type\", COUNT(*) FROM frpm WHERE \"County Name\" = 'Santa Clara' AND \"Charter School (Y/N)\" = 1 GROUP BY \"Charter Funding Type\";"
input.description: Count charter schools by funding type in frpm table

content.text:
Still not 66.7%. The claim says 66.7% which is essentially 2/3. None of the computations match. The actual ratio (using the hint's formula with the schools table) is about 25% (20/80), far from 66.7%.

The claim asserts about 66.7%, but the data shows the ratio is approximately 25% (using schools table) or 30% (using frpm table). The claim is contradicted.
